definition: to start running/the start of a race

to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group
to run/to run away/to escape/to run around (on errands etc)/(of a gas or liquid) to leak or evaporate/(verb complement) away/off
the starting line (of a race)/scratch line (in a relay race)

sentences.english: Standing on the starting line, we're all cowards.
sentences.chinese: 站在起跑线上，我们都是胆小者。

sentences.english: The runners set off at a pace.
sentences.chinese: 赛跑诌以极高的速度起跑。

sentences.english: The racehorse got away from the starting gate.
The racehorse got away from the starting gate.
and start the race at the same starting line.
sentences.chinese: 然后在同一起跑线开始赛跑。

sentences.english: The runners lined up at the start.
sentences.chinese: 赛跑选手们在起跑点排好队。

sentences.english: Provides the information all the way, causes you to win in the starting point.
sentences.chinese: 一路上提供资讯，使你赢在起跑点。

sentences.english: At the whistle, players throw themselves forwards from the starting line like arrows.
sentences.chinese: 随着一声哨响，选手们都箭一般地冲出了起跑线。

sentences.english: A minute of silence was observed for the quake victims before the run.
sentences.chinese: 起跑前，全体与会者向汶川大地震遇难者默哀一分钟。

sentences.english: Staring block is only used in pursuit and team sprint.
sentences.chinese: 起跑器运用于追逐赛和竞速赛中。

sentences.english: He pulled off his race number and headed to the tunnel behind the starting line.
sentences.chinese: 他扯下了比赛号码向起跑线后方的通道走去。

sentences.english: The runners started at5 - minute intervals.
sentences.chinese: 赛跑运动员每隔五分钟起跑一次。

sentences.english: He looked to be walking around tentatively as he got ready to get in the starting blocks.
sentences.chinese: 在起跑器前他试探性地走了几步。

sentences.english: So a starting line was made, and away they went.
sentences.chinese: 他们划了条起跑线，出发了。

sentences.english: Open open teaching time, let your child win on the starting line.
sentences.chinese: 开启智教时期，让孩子赢正在起跑线。

sentences.english: Do not let the fact that you are well-rested fool you into running too fast out of the gate.
sentences.chinese: 起跑时，不要让得到充分休息的你迫不及待地冲出去。

definition: roll-call (e.g. at athletics event)/check the record
the starting line (of a race)/scratch line (in a relay race)
to run/to jog/(military) to march at the double
to run up (pole vault, javelin, bowling etc)/approach/run-up/(aviation) takeoff run
